metadata.title: CVE-2024-37371 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
In MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.21.3, an attacker can cause invalidmemory reads during GSS message token handling by sending message tokenswith invalid length fields.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-37371` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

krb5-admin-server - 1.21.3-3
krb5-gss-samples - 1.21.3-3
krb5-k5tls - 1.21.3-3
krb5-kdc - 1.21.3-3
krb5-kdc-ldap - 1.21.3-3
krb5-kpropd - 1.21.3-3
krb5-locales - 1.21.3-3
krb5-multidev - 1.21.3-3
krb5-otp - 1.21.3-3
krb5-pkinit - 1.21.3-3
krb5-user - 1.21.3-3
libgssapi-krb5-2 - 1.21.3-3
libgssrpc4t64 - 1.21.3-3
libk5crypto3 - 1.21.3-3
libkadm5clnt-mit12 - 1.21.3-3
libkadm5srv-mit12 - 1.21.3-3
libkdb5-10t64 - 1.21.3-3
libkrad0 - 1.21.3-3
libkrb5-3 - 1.21.3-3
libkrb5support0 - 1.21.3-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: krb5 package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.21.3-3').
